review_text: The UI is incredibly easy to navigate and train our staff on. However, the reporting features are too basic for our growing needs.
We love BambooHR for its user-friendly interface. I just wish it integrated better with our customized ATS.
Onboarding is a breeze with this system. But creating custom reports takes way too much manual effort.
Clean UX but lacking deep analytics. We are considering switching to Workday for better enterprise features.
Support is good and the platform is highly intuitive. Integrations with our existing tech stack are unfortunately almost non-existent.
It is wonderfully simple for our small team. I miss the complex features of ADP sometimes though.
Too simple for us now as we scale. Evaluating alternatives because we've simply outgrown its capabilities.
BambooHR handles our basic needs perfectly. The UI is clean, but reporting is definitely its weak point.
Great for maintaining employee files securely. Wish the third-party integrations were more seamless.
The interface is very inviting for new hires. We struggle with getting advanced data cuts out of the system, however.
Very easy to use UI that our team loves. Reporting is limited though, which creates extra spreadsheet work for me.
Love the interface and how modern it feels. Wish the integrations were stronger with our accounting software.
BambooHR is great for onboarding new employees. Custom reports are a pain to configure correctly.
Clean UX but lacking deep analytics out of the box. We are considering switching to Workday for better scale.
Support is good and the platform is intuitive. Integrations with our tech stack are non-existent which is frustrating.
Simple for our small team to manage PTO. I miss the complex features of ADP sometimes though when doing payroll.
Too simple for us now after our recent merger. Evaluating alternatives because we've outgrown it entirely.
The easiest HR software I've ever used. Just don't expect it to handle complex custom data fields well.
Great aesthetic and user experience. Reporting limitations are becoming a dealbreaker for our executive team.
Onboarding is fantastic and automated. Integrating with our benefits provider has been a massive headache.
We adopted BambooHR for its straightforward UI. The reporting module feels like an afterthought.
Excellent for tracking time off and basic info. I wish the integrations were as good as Rippling's.
BambooHR is solid for small business HR. Custom reports are incredibly frustrating to build and export.
Very clean UX that requires zero training. We are considering switching to Workday to consolidate our systems.
Support team is helpful and the platform is intuitive. Integrations are severely lacking compared to competitors.
Simple and effective for our startup. I miss the complex compliance features of ADP sometimes though.
It was great when we were 50 people. Evaluating alternatives because we've outgrown it at 300 employees.
The UI is its biggest selling point. Reporting is basically non-existent if you need advanced metrics.
Great for storing documents and basic employee data. Wish the API integrations were easier to implement.
Employees love the mobile app. As an admin, I find the reporting features severely lacking.
The easiest platform to launch. However, the reporting features are too basic for our growing needs.
We love BambooHR for its user-friendly interface. I just wish it integrated better with our payroll provider.
Terrible reporting capabilities. Considering leaving because we simply cannot get the data we need.
The UI is nice but that is about it. The lack of integrations is forcing us to churn.
Outgrown the platform entirely. It is too basic and we are actively evaluating Workday as a replacement.
Unmatched enterprise features that handle everything we need. Implementation took forever though and was very painful.
Incredibly powerful platform for global teams. It is very complex to learn and train managers on.
Great for large scale HR operations. The UX is a bit dated and hard to navigate for standard users.
Everything is in one place which is great. Compared to BambooHR, the UI is very clunky and rigid.
Robust compliance and reporting for multinational teams. We switched from ADP to Workday and don't regret it.
Implementation was an absolute nightmare. The complexity is just too much for what we actually need.
Enterprise features are top tier. The implementation time was almost double what they initially quoted us.
Powerful automation and workflows. It is incredibly complex to set up and requires a dedicated admin.
Handles our 10k+ employees with ease. The user interface feels like it is stuck in 2010.
All our HR data is centralized now. Compared to Rippling, the UX is extremely outdated.
The best choice for global enterprise. Implementation took over a year and disrupted our entire HR flow.
Highly customizable for our specific business logic. It is very complex to learn for new HR staff.
Great for large scale reporting. The UX is a bit dated and hard to navigate on mobile.
Everything is integrated which reduces errors. Compared to BambooHR, the UI is incredibly clunky.
Amazing compliance modules for our European entities. We switched from ADP to Workday and it improved efficiency.
The complexity is overwhelming for our managers. Considering leaving because adoption is so low across the company.
Enterprise features are unmatched in the market. Implementation took forever and went way over budget.
Incredibly powerful platform if configured correctly. It is very complex to learn and requires expensive consultants.
Great for massive scale and compliance. The UX is a bit dated and very hard to navigate.
Having one source of truth is great. Compared to Gusto, the UI is very clunky and slow.
Robust compliance and granular reporting. We switched from ADP to Workday and our data integrity improved.
Implementation was a complete nightmare. The complexity is just too much and we are evaluating alternatives.
Enterprise features are great once running. Implementation took forever and support was unhelpful during the transition.
Very powerful platform for enterprise. It is highly complex to learn and updates often break our custom reports.
Great for large scale organizational management. The UX is incredibly dated and hard to navigate.
It consolidates everything perfectly. Compared to BambooHR, the UI is a disaster.
Terrible user experience for employees. We are considering leaving to find something more modern and user-friendly.
Way too complex for a mid-sized business. Implementation was a nightmare and we regret the choice.
The system is robust but utterly confusing. Evaluating alternatives because our team refuses to use it.
Enterprise grade but terrible UI. Takes entirely too long to implement and train staff on basic tasks.
The IT and HR automation is incredible. Pricing feels a bit steep as we add more modules.
Modern UX makes onboarding an absolute breeze. Have hit a few bugs since it is a newer product.
Love managing IT devices and HR together. The constant upsells for new modules are getting annoying.
Fastest payroll I've ever run. Thinking about leaving Gusto for Rippling permanently across all our entities.
Great automations and workflows. Rippling's UX blows Paylocity out of the water entirely.
Too many glitches in the new modules. Considering leaving due to the unpredictable and rising pricing.
The automation saves us hours every week. Pricing feels steep but the ROI is definitely there.
Sleek UX makes onboarding a breeze for new hires. We hit a few bugs with the benefits administration tool.
Love managing everything in one platform. The constant upsells from our account manager are annoying.
Payroll takes five minutes to run. Thinking about leaving Gusto for Rippling due to these automations.
Fantastic automations across the board. Rippling's UX blows Paylocity out of the water completely.
Too many glitches in the system lately. Considering leaving due to the unpredictable pricing changes.

Love managing IT and HR together seamlessly. The constant upsells are annoying and distract from the core product.
Fastest payroll I've ever run by far. Switching from Gusto to Rippling was the best decision for our ops.
Great automations that save me time. Rippling's UX blows Paylocity out of the water.
Too many glitches in the new performance module. Considering leaving due to the unpredictable pricing structure.

Love managing IT and HR together. The constant upsells are annoying and aggressive.
Extremely fast payroll processing. Thinking about leaving ADP for Rippling because of the speed.
Pricing is out of control and transparency is zero. Evaluating alternatives because of the massive price hike.
Terrible bugs in the system disrupted our payroll. The modern UX doesn't make up for young product flaws.
Glitchy software with terrible customer support. Considering leaving due to unpredictable pricing and constant errors.
Makes global payroll compliant and incredibly easy. Support response times can be very slow though.
Great for managing our international contractors. Getting a human on chat takes days sometimes.
Simplifies hiring abroad immensely. Customer service needs a major overhaul as they scale.
The compliance features are top notch. Evaluated Rippling but went with Deel for better EOR coverage.
